intro: Henckelia caulescens, commonly known as the slender henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers, which are often blue or violet, bloom in late spring to early summer.
